5 hours ago, MrMeeb said:

Hey guys,

Really quick, nooby question here, but which version of Unity am I supposed to use? I read the forum guide, and it states 4.2.2, but I feel that is out of date, seeing as we are on 5 right now

Cheers

 

 

5.2.4 if you're going to use Unity 5. But unless you're using the newer IVA stuff, you can still use Unity 4.2.2 for nearly all parts, and that will be considerably easier for things that animate heat glow.

Right, okay. This might turn into more of a general 'help me' thread, as I'm going to pose another question. 

I animated my part in Blender, is it possible to import and use this animation in Unity?

yes, you can import the animation from blender into unity.

you dont even have to export the model into .fbx, just drag and drop the blender file directly into your unity scene. You will need to however modify the animation to legacy i believe (going from memory).

1 minute ago, MrMeeb said:

Right, okay. This might turn into more of a general 'help me' thread, as I'm going to pose another question. 

I animated my part in Blender, is it possible to import and use this animation in Unity?

 

 

It should be fine, I would think. What I do is export from Blender as FBX for animations (and de-select "all actions" in my version, but I think the export options changed in newer versions of Blender). Importing into Unity is as simple as dropping the file in your assets folder somewhere (I made a "models" folder for all of mine). Then in Unity, you need to go to the imported model asset and set it to use a scale of "1", and "legacy" animation, and then give the animation a name.
